question.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect about phylum Hemichordata?

options.text: Have a rudimentary structure in the collar region called stomochord.

solution.text:
Phylum Hemichordata has been recently given the status of separate phylum because it lacks a true notochord. It was previously considered as subphylum under the Phylum Chordata. All are marine with bilaterally symmetrical, organ system level of organization, triploblastic, and eucoelomate. The body is made up of anterior proboscis, collar, and a long trunk. Respiration by gills, the circulatory system is of open type. Excretion is by proboscis glands, dioecious and fertilization is external, development is indirect.

Examples : Balanoglossus (Tongueworm), Saccoglosssus.
